alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 12:58AM MST until February 28 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Additional snowfall accumulations of 12 inches for the Sierra Madre Range. Additional snowfall accumulations of 9 inches for the Snowy Range. Winds gusting as high as 60 MPH. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Falling and blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented and lost due to the very poor visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
